These pleasant settings provide a perfect backdrop to get away from it all with the family. Tisha Ghosh Updated: Mar 08, 2025 5:38 PM IST As the main access to Northeast India Guwahati showcases twin identifiers through its well-known cultural legacy and natural beauty with its tranquil lakes presenting ideal destinations for boating while they make excellent locations for relaxation and picnics. These lakes lie within beautiful vegetation as they border hills while they offer people a peaceful reprieve from urban disturbances. People who prioritize outdoor activities and peaceful family reunions along with nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts will all find their joy at these lakes adjacent to Guwahati. The top lakes near Guwahati enable boating and picnics as primary recreational activities for visitors.1. Deepor BeelDeepor Beel stands as Assam's biggest wetland situated about 10 kilometers from Guwahati city southwestward. This Ramsar site (a wetland of international importance) plays a vital role as migratory birds and aquatic species select it for their habitat. Deepor Beel provides visitors a chance to boat peacefully across its tranquil waters as well as offers excellent bird watching opportunities. Local boat services operate country boats which provide guests scenic lake views of the primitive woodland areas.Families can enjoy picnicking amongst trees in the various parks situated near Deepor Beel. Travelers should visit the region in winter when migratory birds visit because the area becomes more lively. Tranquility and closeness to Guwahati make Deepor Beel a necessary exploration point for nature seekers seeking relaxation.2. Silsako LakeThe boating destination Silsako Lake exists about 8 kilometers west of Guwahati city center. Sukreswar Beel receives its former name from its time as part of the ancient waterways that formed the Ahom kingdom. The site acts as a major attraction point for visitors mainly because it provides paddle boating and rowing facilities.People enjoy holding picnics at the lake because it features compact gardens and accessible open spaces. People commonly use their home-cooked food combined with mats for spending family time at the location. The lazy sunlight bestows a warm golden tint to the water while painting a beautiful view during evening hours. History enthusiasts find educational value at Sukreswar Temple which lies not too far from the site. 3. Brajanath BeelBrajanath Beel exists as an intimate boating destination that lies approximately 25 kilometers outside Guwahati city boundaries. Nature enthusiasts will find appeal in this freshwater lake that rests between forested areas and fields filled with paddy. The compact size of Brajanath Beel does not restrict visitors from enjoying peaceful moments and leisure activities.Boaters can hire individually controlled boats from the lake's rental facilities. This uncommercialized location provides complete peace which draws couples and solo adventurers who want private moments. Sunset picnicking at the lake allows visitors to experience the picturesque Assamese natural scenery.4. Umananda Island (Peacock Island)The Brahmaputra River island known as Umananda Island should be included even though it does not officially qualify as a lake because of its singular charm. This diminutive island rests in the middle of the river where passengers can access it through ferry services departing from Kachari Ghat in Guwahati. Visitors who visit the Umananda Temple on this small island can embrace remarkable views across the Brahmaputra River and its scenic environments.Passengers experience thrill through ferry transportation even though boating activities cannot be performed within the island. Most travelers bring their own foods along with drinks to have brief outdoor meals after arriving at the island. People can enjoy two distinct features on Umananda Island through its roaming peacocks and its spiritual temple atmosphere.5. Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary (Mayong Lake Area)Traveling about 50 kilometers eastward from Guwahati, visitors will discover Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary because of its one-horned rhinoceros population. The sanctuary contains several small lakes and wetlands that provide suitable locations for boating and picnicking especially near Mayong village. The sanctuary's ecosystem depends on these water bodies since they foster multiple types of flora as well as wildlife.Pobitora provides a chance for tourists to participate in wildlife tours while spending leisure time at the lakes. The sanctuary authorities protect environmental sustainability by requesting visitors to bring reusable items as well as to keep the area free of litter. The pure waters of these lakes create a remarkable moment when shared with singing birds while deer peacefully graze nearby.Tips for Visiting These Lakes:February is the most suitable time to observe these lakes throughout the winter season between November and February when the temperatures remain pleasant and migratory birds arrive.What to Carry: Pack sunscreen, hats, sunglasses, and comfortable clothing. It is essential to bring snacks together with water bottles and trash bags because these items help you keep the area clean.Boaters should use life jackets at all times while following the instructions of boat operators. Constant attention is required for children whenever they come close to water areas.Practicing eco-friendliness demands the avoidance of plastic waste and the practice of not disrupting wildlife in the area.ConclusionLiving near Guwahati exposes visitors to the perfect blend of recreational thrill and peaceful nature at the region's lakes. Different water destinations in Guwahati offer exclusive travel experiences ranging from world-famous Deepor Beel to small and beautiful Brajanath Beel. The lakes offer spectacular settings because people can paddle among shimmering waters and enjoy family picnics while also appreciating beautiful natural views. Visitors to Guwahati should use their city stay to discover the peaceful atmosphere of these alluring water bodies.
